content: Hyperlab, a sports tech startup, was founded by Hitarth Parikh, a recent graduate of GLS-ID, in collaboration with the faculty of GLSS-ID and Studio Carbon. The startup is dedicated to developing advanced technologies for sports training and rehabilitation. Its leading product, Helios, is a virtual target projection system that enhances athletes' courtcraft, footwork, reflexes, and agility. While providing an enjoyable and gamified training experience, Helios also tracks critical athlete data. Initially comprising of two members, the startup has expanded to a team of fourteen skilled individuals. The company has obtained a patent for the product in India and filed applications for patents in the USA, Europe, and Australia. Hyperlab has received a grant of 45 lakhs from the Gujarat government to support product development, and it aims to democratize sports technology by making it accessible to athletes of all levels.
